assessment_name_examples: Braden Scale - Moisture, Skin Moisture Exposure, Moisture Management

description: Indicates the outcome of the SAT trial (pass or fail), based on flowsheet data charted by the care team. This variable reflects the result of the trial, not whether it was attempted or initiated.
assessment_name_examples: SAT Trial Result, Awakening Trial Outcome, SAT Pass/Fail Status

description: Check for whether the trial was attempted (Boolean:  0/1)
assessment_name_examples: SAT Trial Performed, Awakening Trial Attempted, SAT Completion Status

description: Evaluates if the patient's sedation levels are increasing, which would be a contraindication for performing the SAT.
assessment_name_examples: SAT Screen - Sedation Escalation, Increasing Sedation Check, Rising Sedation Needs

description: Observe for increased intracranial pressure, which is a critical contraindication for the SAT.
assessment_name_examples: SAT Screen - ICP Elevation, Intracranial Pressure Check, ICP Contraindication

description: Identifies whether the patient has signs of active myocardial ischemia, which would preclude performing the SAT.
assessment_name_examples: SAT Screen - Cardiac Ischemia, Active MI Check, Myocardial Ischemia Screen

description: Confirms whether neuromuscular blockers (paralytics) are in use. The SAT cannot proceed if the patient is paralyzed
assessment_name_examples: SAT Screen - Paralytic Use, Neuromuscular Blocker Check, NMB Status

description: Indicates whether the patient passed or failed the SAT safety screen.
assessment_name_examples: SAT Safety Screen Result, SAT Screen Outcome, Awakening Trial Screen Pass/Fail

description: Check for whether the screen was conducted (Boolean:  0/1)
assessment_name_examples: SAT Screen Completed, Safety Screen Performed, SAT Screen Documentation

description: Checks whether the patient is receiving sedative infusions, for e.g., sedatives used for seizure control or alcohol withdrawal. Sedation for these conditions must be absent for the SAT to proceed.
assessment_name_examples: SAT Screen - Sedative Infusion, Continuous Sedation Check, Active Sedation Status

description: Determines if the patient is excessively agitated, which would indicate they are not ready to tolerate breathing on their own.
assessment_name_examples: SBT Screen - Agitation Level, Patient Agitation Check, Excessive Agitation Status

description: Indicates the outcome of the SAT trial (pass or fail), based on flowsheet data charted by the care team. This variable reflects the result of the trial, not whether it was attempted or initiated.
assessment_name_examples: SBT Trial Result, Breathing Trial Outcome, SBT Pass/Fail Status

description: Check for whether the trial was attempted (Boolean:  0/1)
assessment_name_examples: SBT Trial Performed, Breathing Trial Attempted, SBT Completion Status

description: A text string field to document the reason for SBT failure, if present (e.g., "tachypnea," "acute change in mental status," or "hypoxemia").
assessment_name_examples: SBT Failure Reason, Breathing Trial Failure Documentation, SBT Discontinuation Reason

description: Assesses for hypoxia or inadequate oxygen levels (SpO_ < 88% or FiO_ ï¿½ 50%). Sufficient oxygenation is required before the SBT can be conducted.
assessment_name_examples: SBT Screen - Oxygenation Status, Hypoxia Check, Adequate O2 Assessment

description: Monitors for elevated intracranial pressure. Increased pressure is a critical factor for SBT exclusion.
assessment_name_examples: SBT Screen - ICP Check, Intracranial Pressure Status, ICP Contraindication

description: Identifies the absence of spontaneous breathing efforts. If no spontaneous effort is detected, the trial cannot proceed.
assessment_name_examples: SBT Screen - Spontaneous Effort, Breathing Effort Check, Respiratory Drive Assessment

description: Indicates whether the patient passed or failed the SBT safety screen
assessment_name_examples: SBT Safety Screen Result, SBT Screen Outcome, Breathing Trial Screen Pass/Fail

description: Check for  whether the screen was conducted (Boolean:  0/1)
assessment_name_examples: SBT Screen Completed, Safety Screen Performed, SBT Screen Documentation

description: Evaluate whether the patient is on significant doses of vasopressors (medications used to support blood pressure). High doses can be a sign of hemodynamic instability, preventing the SBT.
assessment_name_examples: SBT Screen - Vasopressor Requirement, High-Dose Pressors, Hemodynamic Stability Check
Train-of-Four, TOF Stimulation, Neuromuscular Blockade Assessment
Visual Analog Scale Pain, VAS Pain Score, 0-100 Pain Rating
Withdrawal Assessment Tool, WAT-1 Pediatric, Pediatric Withdrawal Score
